News.Title: Compuage Infocom's Committee of Creditors Approves Multiple Resolutions Including Asset Sales and Insurance Renewals
News.Summary: Compuage Infocom Limited's 21st Committee of Creditors meeting concluded with e-voting on November 6, 2025. The committee approved several key resolutions including terms for a 7th e-auction of rejected inventory at Bhiwandi warehouse, sale of inventory at Singapore warehouse, renewal of fire insurance policies for office premises, and comprehensive maintenance contract for air conditioners. The committee also approved debt settlements with G.P. Tronics Private Limited and FlipIT Technologies Private Limited, appointed R.I. Jain Co. Chartered Accountants for scrutiny assessment proceedings for AY 2024-25, and granted extension for the Annual General Meeting. Additionally, they approved extension/exclusion of Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process under Section 12 and ratified lawyer appointment for High Court proceedings. However, a proposal for acquisition of inventory at Singapore branch was rejected. The company remains under Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process with Resolution Professional Gajesh Labhchand Jain managing its affairs.
